intro: Staphisagria hirtella, commonly known as the hairy staphisagria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in herbal remedies.
